page.title: 12ENTERTAINMENT IN TADLEY
page.content: Tadley has a small old fashioned cinema, run on a voluntary basis, which shows a mixture of slightly blue films, cartoons and the occasional major feature. There are no theatres, disco's or nightclubs, for those you must go elsewhere. Most entertainment is of the self-made kind, there are many events organised by local groups such as Parent Teacher Associations, political parties, Scout or Cub Packs and WI's, in Church and Parish Halls. They include Barn dances, barbecues and disco's. There are also local operatic, dramatic and musical societies who provide shows for all tastes. However, as in most towns and villages, many people are quite content to stay at home and watch television, or at the most go to the local pub for the evening.
